English: O, these are my hands... Why are they here?
Drag the Hit command to below to activate it.
This enemy keeps my legs. How come?
Drag the Jump command to below to activate it.
You may see that while you put the command to Hold, it also change the Release action.
For some commands like Jump, if you want to trigger it by Hold, it must link to Release and perform a Charged Jump.
Some commands have seperated Hold and Release action. Try it yourself to discover more combinations!
Hold the tap of the right side of the screen and then Release to perform the Charged Jump action you just activated.
My thrusters! I don't remember I have thrown them here.
Drag the Dash command to below to activate it.
There is an enemy. I can beat it!
Tap the right side of the screen to perform the Hit action you just activated.
Enemies will become invincible after being attacked. Continue to attack the enemies after their invincible period finished.
When you touch the wall, your will turn and move in the opposite direction.
Attack the enemy at the right time so that you can walk away from it while its invincible period.
The wall is too high. I think I need to use the In Air action to overcome.
Drag the Jump command to below to activate it.
While you are in air, tap the right side of the screen to perform the Air Jump action you just activated.
When you touch the wall while in air, you will slide on the wall.
You can perform In Air action while you are sliding on the wall.
Let's try it. First, <color #00ffff>perform the Charged Jump</color> action.
Now you are sliding on the wall and you can perform In Air action.
Try to <color #00ffff>perform the Air Jump</color> action.
<color #00ffff>Perform the Air Jump</color> action repeatedly to overcome this huge wall!
This enemy is flying. I would need to hit in air in order to beat it.
Drag the Hit command to below to activate it.
Then, Hold the tap of the right side of the screen and then Release to perform the Finishing Hit action you just activated.
This valley seems so deep. Let's have a look.
<color #00ffff>Drag the left side of the screen from up to down</color> to look down.
You can also drag to other directions to look at those directions.
By looking around, you may know more about the environment and may have more time to react to it.
You may also discover some unexpected stuff!
I cannot see the bottom even looking down. I must be careful not to fall down the valley.
Um...There are some stings in front. It seems very dangerous.
Maybe I should search to see if I can get anything to go through it.
Why are you look just like me?
You want to practise with me?
Who are I? Where are I?
There is a cave ahead. Let's have a look.
Before starting your adventure, you can set your commands.
You can <color #00ffff>drag a command to below</color> to assign it to an action.
You can also <color #00ffff>click on an assigned action</color> and <color #00ffff>press the cross button</color> to remove the command.
During your adventure, you may want to reassign your commands.
You can do it by pressing the restart button in pause menu.
But note that if you restart the adventure, all the progress (except the collected items) would also be reset.
Ar yes, I have to search for this cave.
